main event: Lt Col. J. L. Williams, USAF, observed a bright, stationary light at 26N147W in the Pacific Ocean on 7 July 1961.
interesting points: The light was steady and multi-colored., The observation lasted for approximately 5-10 minutes., The object was evaluated as being too bright to be a star., The sighting was recorded as a possible satellite re-entry., The report concluded that there was no threat from the sighting.
witness description: Lt Col. J. L. Williams, USAF, 1st Tactical Fighter Wing
